content: a very simple and easy asymmetrical shawl that is easy enough for a beginning knitter it starts with 5 stitches and can be worked as large as you like it is shown here as a fingering weight shawlette but it could be made with any weight of yarn see below the pattern calls for two skeins of compatible cashmere held together or at least 164 yards of any fingering weight yarn it is an easy two row pattern that is reversible and suitable for a beginning knitter suggested needle sizes for other weights of yarn mohair + carry along sequin yarn us 7 4 5mm chunky mohair poema alpaca or similar us 10 6mm sport to dk us 6-7 4-4 5mm worsted to aran us 8-9 5-5 5mm bulky us 10-10 5 6-6 5mm note you will need more yardage for larger yarns the exact amount will vary depending on the yarn weight thickness and the desired size of the shawl
